page.title: 13Ulverston Charter Week
page.content: Ulverston was granted its{Market {Charter}on 11th September{1280.}In 1980 the town decided to celebrate the 700th anniversary of the signing of the Charter with a week of special events. This venture was so successful and enjoyed so much that the{Charter {week celebrations}became an annual event. Every September a Charter Princess is chosen to attend events and celebrations,including Church services,lantern processions,town crier contests,discos,road races,barn dances,Furness Morris Men,Town Band, Mayor's Charter Ball,raft races on the canal and the Mariners' Ball.The Prin- cess also attends the town's summer Carnival Parade. She wears a white satin sash with the words "Charter Princess". These celebrations bring the town together;everyone joins in and enjoys themselves.
